text.t59122f23: IF I INTEND TO PLEAD GUILTY, SHOULD I STILL HIRE A LAWYER?
text.t88e2b7a: You should always speak with a criminal law firm prior to representing yourself because it is possible to represent yourself for simple/minor charges. It’s important to understand that you may not understand the complexity of your situation and that your freedom is on the line. Knowing your rights and what a defense attorney can do for you is huge, even for misdemeanors. Felonies are always too serious to represent yourself.
text.tnbc30c38: HOW IMPORTANT IS EXPERIENCE FOR A CRIMINAL DEFENSE ATTORNEY?
text.tn460bd3c: It’s always crucial to hire an experienced lawyer because you don’t want to work with anyone that’s still learning on the job. Practice certainly makes perfect when it comes to criminal law, and you should always find a criminal defense firm that has many years of experience working within Santa Clara County.
text.t6add355f: CAN I GET MY CHARGE DISMISSED?
text.t1a9d993b: Yes, it is possible within a whole variety of ways to have your criminal charge dismissed. Some common ways that criminal charges are dismissed are through conditional/diversion discharges, exclusion of witnesses/depositions, exclusion of evidence/suppressions, evidentiary issues, affirmative defenses, and plea negotiations.
text.tn484fcc91: CAN I HAVE MY CASE CLEARED FROM MY RECORD?
text.tn1c4007ca: Clearing a criminal record is of course a lot easier said than done, but there are ways that you can clear your record of criminal charges. You can sometimes pay mandatory fines or undergo a rehabilitation program to clear your record. Not every crime can be cleared from your criminal record, and the more serious the offense the less likely you’ll be able to obtain clearance.
text.t59f1318: WILL MY PROFESSIONAL LICENSE BE SUSPENDED (i.e. MEDICAL, REAL ESTATE, etc.)
text.tn7f225172: It is possible to lose your professional license when you’ve been charged with certain criminal offenses, and this is especially the case if you’re convicted.
text.tn5231357d: WILL THE PUBLIC BE ABLE TO SEE THAT I WAS ARRESTED?
text.t5acf9daf: Yes, your arrest record will be within a public record in the state of California.
text.tn75954ebb: WILL THIS CRIME GO ON MY RECORD?
text.tn1d449315: Your criminal record is a comprehensive overview of your personal criminal history, so your record will list all non-expunged criminal charges and convictions.
text.tn2ad9ffbe: CAN I GET THE CHARGES REDUCED?
text.tn9256acb: Absolutely, there are many ways in which our criminal law specialists will help you reduce your charges. We’ll do what is possible to have your charges dismissed or dropped, or we’ll get your charges reduced via a plea bargain.

WHAT DOES A CRIMINAL LAWYER DO?

It’s important to understand what our San Jose CA attorneys will actually do for you or your loved one throughout the entirety of your legal proceedings.   • Trial Participation: Our legal team will fight for you during a trial with all of our experience and knowledge at your disposal. This will include examining witnesses, cross-examining the prosecution’s witnesses, and ultimately convincing the jury of your innocence or the prosecution’s failure to meet a sufficient burden of proof.
  • Sentencing: If a client of ours is in fact sentenced to a crime or accepts a plea bargain, then it’ll be our job to represent you during the sentencing negotiations. We’ll help limit the amount of incarceration time or help you obtain alternatives to incarceration.

CALIFORNIA CRIMINAL COURT PROCESS

The court process within California is like many other states, but it will have its own unique qualities. When you’re arrested and booked, you’ll likely have the opportunity to obtain bail and be released from jail. When you hire Summit Defense as your private defense attorney, you may be able to skip some later court appearances as we’ll represent you.

Arraignment Hearing:

You’ll then go through an arraignment hearing, and this is where your defense lawyer and prosecutors will try to reach a resolution without needing to go to trial. The San Jose District Attorney may decide to dismiss your case or reduce charges through a plea agreement during your arraignment, depending upon the strength of their case.

Preliminary Hearing:

Those charged with felonies will be entitled to a preliminary hearing, and the purpose of this hearing is to give the prosecutors an opportunity to present their case to the California court and show that they in fact have a substantial amount of evidence to press charges against you. The burden of proof is low in preliminary hearings because they only have to prove the probable cause of the defendant’s guilt, so it is common for prosecutors to win these cases. However, if our defense lawyers win your preliminary case, then your charges are dismissed.

If you do end up getting convicted of a crime, you’ll then have a sentence imposed upon you by a judge. There are many instances in which a judge will grant probation instead of jail time, and our legal specialists will ensure that your sentence is as favorable as possible if this situation arises.

CALIFORNIA VIOLENT CRIME CHARGES

The definition of violent offenses in California is undoubtedly complex, and Penal Code 667.5 provides detailed information about violent crimes in Santa Clara County and California. Some example of violent felonies in California include:

  • Murder
  • Voluntary manslaughter
  • Rape
  • Mayhem
  • Oral copulation
  • Sodomy
  • Lewd acts on a child under 14 years old
  • Robbery
  • Felonies that inflict bodily injury
  • Arson
  • Attempted murder
  • Kidnapping
  • Assault with intent to commit a felony
  • Carjacking
  • Extortion
  • And much more…

CALIFORNIA SEX CRIMES DEFENSE CHARGES

Penal Code 243.4 dictates certain sexual crimes in California, and some charges associated with this code include sexual battery and all of its subsequent criminal associations.

CALIFORNIA DUI CRIME CHARGES

Penal Code 23152 prohibits anyone driving a motor vehicle under the influence of alcohol or drugs, and this law is much broader than most people would probably assume. Our San Jose criminal defense law firm will help you defend yourself against these complex criminal charges.
